metadata.Title: CVE-2022-32214 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The llhttp parser <v14.20.1, <v16.17.1 and <v18.9.1 in the http module in Node.js does not strictly use the CRLF sequence to delimit HTTP requests. This can lead to HTTP Request Smuggling (HRS).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-32214` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnode72 - 12.22.9~dfsg-1ubuntu3.2
nodejs - 12.22.9~dfsg-1ubuntu3.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nodejs package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '12.22.9~dfsg-1ubuntu3.2').
